item.title: Dead fox, 20th October

item.title: Flooding, 20th October
item.description:
Opposite 45 Erith Road Issue ongoing for over 10 years Occurs after every period of sustained rain Often water crosses the median line By the reaction of drivers, it is not apparent until very close Can take hours to drain away

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Erith Road, Lessness Heath, London

item.title: Drain blocked, huge lake forming, 20th October
item.description:
The drain is blocked when crossing station road towards the station. Difficult to get around due to depth and length. Prams and wheelchairs users unable to use dipped kerb.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Queen's Mead Road, Shortlands, London

item.title: Top end of southlands road, litter not picked up, 20th October

item.title: Whole road litter, 20th October
item.description:

item.title: No footpath cleaning of leaves and litter, 20th October
item.description:
Footpath from Waterside to Blakeney Road remains continually uncleared of leafage and litter . When wet it is treacherous to walk and a number of local residents have slipped causing sprained ankles.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rectory Road, Beckenham, London

item.title: Thereâ€™s a building site on our road which doesnâ€™t have a clear boundary. As a result, people have started constantly fly tipping there, 20th October
